                                 Release Notes
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
David (Hard Candy) Slade directs this nerve-jangling adaptation of the popular 
graphic novel series about a mob of vampires that overruns a remote Alaskan town 
in the grip of 30 Days of Night. Josh Hartnett and Melissa George are the film&#039;s 
de facto heroes (he&#039;s the stoic town sheriff and she&#039;s his estranged 
fire-marshal wife) but the picture&#039;s real MVP is Slade&#039;s camera (along with 
cinematographer Jo Willems), which careens across the town&#039;s snowy landscape to 
detail the vampires&#039; horrific assault on its inhabitants, which are quickly 
pared down to a hardy few. The script, co-written by the source material&#039;s 
creator, Steve Niles, along with Pirates of the Caribbean&#039;s Stuart Beattie and 
Hard Candy&#039;s Brian Nelson), proudly wears its influences on its crimson-stained 
sleeve (Bram Stoker&#039;s Dracula, natch, but also &#039;Salem&#039;s Lot, Night of the Living 
Dead, and John Carpenter&#039;s version of The Thing) and boils down the graphic 
novels to a series of tense and extremely bloody standoffs between Harnett and 
George&#039;s band of survivors and the vaguely Slavic and ferocious bloodsuckers led 
by Marlow (a feral and frightening Danny Huston). And if the characters seem 
stock and the finale begs suspension of disbelief, the set pieces leading up to 
it are sufficiently supercharged with suspense and violence to please most 
horror fans. Standouts in the supporting cast are Ben Foster as the film&#039;s 
Renfield figure and Mark Boone Junior.

Director: David Slade

Writers : Steve Niles
        : Stuart Beattie

Cast    : Josh Hartnett
        : Melissa George
        : Danny Huston
        : Ben Foster
        : Mark Boone Junior

Enjoy this movie.
